You are not a loser. I literally just 3 minutes ago, posted in r/marriage. I said the exact same thing, I feel so dumb for thinking my husband would change. He would treat me as his Queen. He doesn‚Äôt chase me. He doesn‚Äôt show that he cherishes me. He is NOT AFRAID TO LOSE ME. We‚Äôve been married for 11 years, we have 5 kids total (well, he has 2 with his baby mother and I had 3 when we got married then we had 2 more, so 5 in our home) and we are 3 years into our 30 year mortgage. He was with his baby mama when we hooked up. Except, I knew they were together. I told her I would babysit while she worked and while he was ‚Äúat a job‚Äù and we messed around, didn‚Äôt fuck, but then about a week later, he came to stay with me while we looked for a place to rent. And within 6 months, we were married. He‚Äôs lied our entire relationship, but I gave him the benefit of the doubt, and I feel so stupid now but I believed him when he said he was just getting a ride for, Angela because no one else was around. The day before that she told me to my face ‚Äúhey, aren‚Äôt you and to,my married now? I said yes (we had married a couple days before this). She said okay good, I only fuck married men.‚Äù I should have beat her fucking ass then and there, but I didn‚Äôt. Then next day, he randomly caught a ride from her (pun intended dammit) and when he got out of the car, I ran to her window and tried jumping through it. But I should‚Äôve jumped on him. Either way, don‚Äôt blame yourself, op. You don‚Äôt deserve to be cheated on, no matter who had a girlfriend or when they had that girlfriend. But I do believe, now, once a cheater, always a cheater.
